quest_title: The position vectors of points A, B, C and D are \(A = 3 \hat { i } + 4 \hat { j } + 5 \hat { k } , B = 4 \hat { i } + 5 \hat { j } + 6 \hat { k } , C = 7 \hat { i } + 9 \hat { j } + 3 \hat { k }\) and \(D = 4 \hat { i } + 6 \hat { j }\), then the displacement vectors AB and CD are
explanation_txt: \(\begin{array} { l } { \vec { A B } = ( 4 \hat { i } + 5 \hat { j } + 6 \hat { k } ) - ( 3 \hat { i } + 4 \hat { j } + 5 \hat { k } ) = \hat { i } + \hat { j } + \hat { k } } \\ { \vec { C D } = ( 4 \hat { i } + 6 \hat { j } ) - ( 7 \hat { i } + 9 \hat { j } + 3 \hat { k } ) = - 3 \hat { i } - 3 \hat { j } - 3 \hat { k } } \\ { \vec { A B } \text { and } \vec { C D } \text { are parallel, because its cross-products is } 0 . } \end{array}\)

quest_title: Lamps used for household lighting are connected in
explanation_txt:
Because all lamps operate in 220 voltage. Moreover, parallel connection has following advantages over series connection:-

  • Breaking of one lamp does not affect the electrical connectivity of other lamps.
  • Power dissipated by one lamp is not affected by the number of lamps connected across it.
question_plain_title: Lamps used for household lighting are connected in
explanation_plain_text:
Because all lamps operate in 220 voltage. Moreover, parallel connection has following advantages over series connection:-

  • Breaking of one lamp does not affect the electrical connectivity of other lamps.
  • Power dissipated by one lamp is not affected by the number of lamps connected across it.

So, the required interval is \( [1,2] \)

quest_title: A man walks on a straight road from his home to a market 2.5 km away with a speed of 5 km/h. Finding the market closed, he instantly turns and walks back home with a speed of 7.5 km/h. The average speed of the man over the interval of time 0 to 40 min is equal to
explanation_txt:
A man walks from his home to market with a speed of \(5\mathrm { km } / \mathrm { h }\) for distance \(= 2.5 \mathrm { km }\) taking time \(= \cfrac { d } { v } = \cfrac { 2.5 } { 5 } = \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } \mathrm { hr }\).

He returns back with speed of \(7.5\mathrm { km } / \mathrm { h }\) in rest of time of 10 minutes.

\(\begin{array} { l } { \text { Distance } = 7.5 \times \cfrac { 10 } { 60 } = 1.25 \mathrm { km } } \\ { \text { So, Average speed } = \cfrac { \text { Total distance } } { \text { Total time } }= \cfrac { ( 2.5 + 1.25 ) k m } { ( 40 / 60 ) h r } = \cfrac { 45 } { 8 } k m / h r } \end{array}\)
question_plain_title: A man walks on a straight road from his home to a market 2.5 km away with a speed of 5 km/h. Finding the market closed, he instantly turns and walks back home with a speed of 7.5 km/h. The average speed of the man over the interval of time 0 to 40 min is equal to
explanation_plain_text:
A man walks from his home to market with a speed of for distance taking time .

He returns back with speed of in rest of time of 10 minutes.

or, \(\cfrac{-3 m g R}{4}=\cfrac{-m g R^{2}}{R+h}\)
or, \(3(R+h)=4 R\)
or, \(h=R / 3\)

quest_title: When hypo \(\text{(Na\(_{2}\)S\(_{2}\)O\(_{3}\).}\) \(\text{5H\(_{2}\)O)}\) reacts with iodine. Sodium tetrathionate \(\text{(Na\(_{2}\)S\(_{4}\)O\(_{6}\))}\) is obtained. The eq.wt. of hypo is (M= Mol.wt. of \(\text{Na\(_{2}\)S\(_{2}\)O\(_{3}\))}\)
explanation_txt:
\(2Na_2\overset{+2}S_2O_3.5H_2O +I_2 \to Na_2\overset{+2.5}S_4O_6+2NaI\)

Change in ON per 2 mole = 2*2*2-2.5*4 = -2

Change in ON per mole = -1

Thus equivalent weight = M/1

explanation_plain_text:

quest_title: With the rise in temperature, the dielectric constant of a liquid
explanation_txt: With temperature rise, dielectric constant of liquid decreases. The decrease in the dielectric constant is due to increase of thermal oscillation of the molecules and increase of degree of disorder of dipoles.
question_plain_title: With the rise in temperature, the dielectric constant of a liquid
explanation_plain_text: With temperature rise, dielectric constant of liquid decreases. The decrease in the dielectric constant is due to increase of thermal oscillation of the molecules and increase of degree of disorder of dipoles.

quest_title: A uniform electric field having a magnitude \(\text{E}\)\({}_{0}\) and direction along + x-axis exists. If the electric potential \(\text{V}\) is zero at \(\text{x}\) = 0, its value at \(\text{x}\) = + \(\text{X}\) will be
explanation_txt:
\(E_{0}=-(\Delta V / \Delta X)\)
\(\begin{aligned} \Rightarrow & \Delta V=-E_{0} X \\ \text { Here, } & V(0)=0 \\ \therefore & V(X)=-X E_{0} \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: How many millilitre of 0.02M NaOH solution are needed to reach completely with 100ml of 0.01M sulphuric acid?
explanation_txt:
100 ml of 0.01 M sulphuric acid = 100 ml of 0.02 N sulphuric acid

0.02 M NaOH = 0.02 N NaOH

\(\therefore\) 100 ml of 0.02 NaOH is required to balance 100 ml of 0.02N sulphuric acid.
question_plain_title: How many millilitre of 0.02M NaOH solution are needed to reach completely with 100ml of 0.01M sulphuric acid?
explanation_plain_text:
100 ml of 0.01 M sulphuric acid = 100 ml of 0.02 N sulphuric acid

0.02 M NaOH = 0.02 N NaOH

100 ml of 0.02 NaOH is required to balance 100 ml of 0.02N sulphuric acid.

explanation_txt:

quest_title: In a cyclic process, work done by the system is
ans2_txt: Equal to heat given to the system
ans3_txt: More than the heat given to system
ans4_txt: Independent of heat given to the system
explanation_txt: In a cyclic process, \(\Delta U=0\) so from first law of thermodynamics \(\Delta Q=\Delta W\).

quest_title: A concave mirror and a convex mirror of focal length 20cm each are placed facing each other at 50cm apart. An object is placed mid way between them. The position of image if the reflection first takes place in concave then in convex mirror
explanation_txt:
\(\quad\)For concave mirror

\(\quad\)\(v\) = \( \cfrac{fu}{u - f} = \cfrac{20\times 25}{25 - 20} \) = 100cm

\(\quad\)For convex mirror

\(\quad\)u = -(100 - 50) = -50cm

\(\quad\)\(v\) = \( \cfrac{fu}{u - f} = \cfrac{\left(-20\right) \left(-50\right)}{-50 + 20} = \cfrac{-1000}{30} \) = -33.3cm

\(\quad\)33.3cm behind convex mirror

quest_title: An air filled parallel plate capacitor has a capacitance 1PF. The separation of plates is doubled and wax is inserted between them which makes capacitance 2PF. The dielectric constant of wax is.
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{C}=\cfrac{\varepsilon_{0} \mathrm{A}}{\mathrm{d}}=1 \mathrm{PF}=10^{-12} \mathrm{F}\)
\(\mathrm{C}^{\prime}=\cfrac{\varepsilon_{\varepsilon} \varepsilon_{0} \mathrm{A}}{2 \mathrm{d}}\)
or, \(2 \times 10^{-12}=\cfrac{\varepsilon_{\mathrm{r}}}{2} \times 10^{-12}\)
or, \(\varepsilon_{\mathrm{r}}=4\)

explanation_txt:

quest_title: \(\quad\)For a dilute solution Raoult's law states that
ans1_txt: \(\quad\)The lowering of vapour pressure is equal to the mole fraction of solute

ans4_plain_text: The vapour pressure of the solution is equal to the mole fraction of the solvent.

quest_title:
\(\mathrm{SO}_{2}\) gas was prepared by 
 (i) burning sulphur in oxygen, 
 (ii) reacting sodium sulphite with dilute \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{2}\). 
 It was found that in each case the ratio of mass of sulphur and oxygen is constant. This result illustrates the law of:
explanation_txt: A given chemical compound always contains its component elements in fixed ratio (by mass) and does not depend on its source and method of preparation. This is the law of constant proportions.
question_plain_title: gas was prepared by (i) burning sulphur in oxygen, (ii) reacting sodium sulphite with dilute . It was found that in each case the ratio of mass of sulphur and oxygen is constant. This result illustrates the law of:
